means: 最活跃或最激烈的部分
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 西克绰号，矮胖者，来源于古英语，含义是“粗壮的”(thick)

sentence.Network_en: Teddy ran thick fingers through his unruly thatch of hair.
sentence.Network_cn: 特迪用自己的粗手指头捋了一下浓密蓬乱的头发。

sentence.Network_en: My underskirt had ridden up into a thick band around my hips.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的衬裙已经蹿到臀部，厚厚地卷成一圈。

sentence.Network_en: A thick haze of acrid smoke hung in the air.
sentence.Network_cn: 空气中弥漫着刺鼻的浓烟。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)太过分，令人受不了，不公平的，没有道理的

phrase.cizu_name: give someone (或 get) a thick ear

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)punish someone (or be punished) with a blow, especially on the ear
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)（被）揍…以作惩罚；（被）搧…耳光

phrase.cizu_name: in (或 into) the thick of something

jx.jx_en_mean: in (or into) the busiest or most crowded part of something
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在…最激烈时，在…最紧张的时刻；处在…的深处

lj.lj_ly: we were in the thick of the traffic.
lj.lj_ls: 我们处在交通最繁忙的时候。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 大量而急速地；频频地；快速地

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)(of two or more people) very close or friendly; sharing secrets
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（两人或两人以上）亲密无间，非常友好

phrase.cizu_name: as thick as two (short) planks (或 as a plank)

lj.lj_ly: he was borrowing the thick end of £750 every week.
lj.lj_ls: 每周的750镑他大部分是借来的。

jx.jx_en_mean: under all circumstances, no matter how difficult
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不顾艰难险阻，在任何情况下；赴汤蹈火

lj.lj_ly: they stuck together through thick and thin.
lj.lj_ls: 他们在任何困难的情况下都相互支持。

lj.lj_ly: They remained friends through thick and thin.
lj.lj_ls: 他们在任何情况下都是好朋友

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English thicce, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch dik and German dick

encyclopedia.content: thick英音：[θik]美音：[θɪk] thick的中文翻译以下结果由译典通提供词典解释形容词 a. 1.厚的；粗的 How thick is the board? 这块木板有多厚？ 2.浓的，浓厚的；粘稠的；混浊的 It is dangerous to drive in a thick fog. 在浓雾天驾车很危险。 3.充满。..的；长满。..的[F][(+with)] The air was thick with smoke. 空气中烟雾弥漫。 4.茂密的；密集的 We saw a few cabins by the edge of the thick forest. 我们在

entry.def: Something that is thick has a large distance between its two opposite sides.

example.ex: For breakfast I had a thick slice of bread and syrup...
example.tran: 早餐我吃了一片厚厚的涂了糖浆的面包。

example.ex: He wore glasses with thick rims...
example.tran: 他戴了一副厚框眼镜。

entry.def: You can use thick to talk or ask about how wide or deep something is.

example.ex: The folder was two inches thick...
example.tran: 那个文件夹有两英寸厚。

example.ex: How thick are these walls?
example.tran: 这些墙有多厚？

entry.tran: 浓的;密的;密集的;茂密的
entry.def: If something that consists of several things is thick, it has a large number of them very close together.

example.ex: She inherited our father's thick, wavy hair...
example.tran: 她继承了我们父亲那头浓密的卷发。

example.ex: They walked through thick forest.
example.tran: 他们徒步穿越了茂密的森林。

entry.def: If something is thick with another thing, the first thing is full of or covered with the second.

example.ex: The air is thick with acrid smoke from the fires...
example.tran: 空气中弥漫着火灾产生的刺鼻浓烟。

example.ex: She ate scones thick with butter.
example.tran: 她吃了一些涂满了黄油的烤饼。

entry.def: Thick clothes are made from heavy cloth, so that they will keep you warm in cold weather.

example.ex: In the winter she wears thick socks, Wellington boots and gloves...
example.tran: 冬天，她穿着厚袜子和橡胶雨靴，戴着手套。

example.ex: She wore a thick tartan skirt and a red cashmere sweater.
example.tran: 她穿了一条厚厚的格子呢裙和一件红色羊绒衫。

entry.tran: (烟、雾、云)浓的，混浊的，能见度低的
entry.def: Thick smoke, fog, or cloud is difficult to see through.

example.ex: The smoke was bluish-black and thick...
example.tran: 那烟黑中带蓝，而且很浓。

example.ex: It wasn't very thick fog.
example.tran: 雾不算很浓。

entry.def: Thick liquids are fairly stiff and solid and do not flow easily.

example.ex: They had to battle through thick mud to reach construction workers...
example.tran: 他们只好挣扎着穿过厚厚的泥巴去找建筑工人。

example.ex: The sauce is thick and rich so don't bother trying to diet.
example.tran: 这个酱汁又浓又香，别费劲节食了。

entry.tran: (声音)不清楚的，沙哑的，低沉的
entry.def: If someone's voice is thick, they are not speaking clearly, for example because they are ill, upset, or drunk.

example.ex: When he spoke his voice was thick with bitterness.
example.tran: 他说话时，声音低沉，充满痛苦。

entry.def: A thick accent is very obvious and easy to identify.

example.ex: He answered our questions in English but with a thick accent...
example.tran: 他用英语回答了我们的问题，不过口音很重。

example.ex: 'What do you want?' a teenage girl demanded in a thick German accent.
example.tran: “你想要什么？”一个十几岁少女操着一口浓重的德国口音问道。

entry.def: If you describe someone as thick, you think they are stupid.

example.ex: How could she have been so thick?
example.tran: 她怎么能蠢到那个地步？

entry.tran: 大量而迅速地;接二连三地
entry.def: If things happen thick and fast, they happen very quickly and in large numbers.

example.ex: The rumours have been coming thick and fast...
example.tran: 谣言接二连三地传来。

example.ex: Distress calls were pouring in thick and fast from all over the area.
example.tran: 求救电话从该地区各地蜂拥而至。

entry.def: If you are in the thick of an activity or situation, you are very involved in it.

example.ex: I enjoy being in the thick of things...
example.tran: 我喜欢全身心投入到事情当中。

example.ex: Peterson suddenly found himself in the thick of desperate fighting.
example.tran: 彼得森突然发现自己身陷一场殊死搏斗中。

entry.tran: 不顾艰难险阻;历尽千辛万苦
entry.def: If you do something through thick and thin, you do it although the conditions or circumstances are very bad.

example.ex: She'd stuck by Bob through thick and thin...
example.tran: 她对鲍勃不离不弃，甘苦与共。

example.ex: I will go on loving James through thick and thin no matter what happens.
example.tran: 不管发生什么，不管经历多少艰辛，我都会一直爱着詹姆斯。

means.word_mean: 1. the location of something surrounded by other things;
1. not thin; of a specific thickness or of relatively great extent from one surface to the opposite usually in the smallest of the three solid dimensions;
4. spoken as if with a thick tongue;
6. hard to pass through because of dense growth;
9. heavy and compact in form or stature;

sentences.sentence: "the bartender was chummy with the regular customers"
"the two were thick as thieves for months"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: To serve, carve each Wellington into thick slices.

auth_sentence.res_content: To serve, carve the lamb into thick slices.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To serve, carve the lamb into thick slices.

auth_sentence.content: You certainly need to have thick skin for it!
auth_sentence.res_content: You certainly need to have thick skin for it!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You certainly need to have thick skin for it!

Sentence.sentence: where lawyer-moms are thick on the ground.
The West Antarctic ice sheet was about 7,000 feet thick.
Scientists agree that key player in this scenario is the West Antarctic ice sheet, a Brazil-size mass of frozen water that is much as 7000 feet thick

sentences.en: She was still wearing her thick coat.

means.word_mean: 稠密的, 密集的, 茂密的

sentences.en: Thick liquid pours much more slowly than thin liquid.
sentences.cn: 稠的液体倒出来比稀的慢。

means.word_mean: 很明显的, 重的; 不清楚的, 浓重的

sentences.en: Grandfather spoke with a thick Scottish brogue.
sentences.cn: 祖父说话带有很重的苏格兰土腔。

means.word_mean: 充满的; 布满的; 拥满；挤满；弥漫

sentences.en: The train was thick with students.

jushi.english: Thick smoke came out of the burning building.
jushi.chinese: 浓烟是从那幢燃烧的大楼里冒出来的。

jushi.english: A field of burning grass billowed thick black clouds of smoke into the sky.
jushi.chinese: 一块燃烧着的草地冒起黑色浓烟,滚滚上升天际。

jushi.english: Thick liquid pours much more slowly than thin liquid.
jushi.chinese: 稠的液体倒出来比稀的慢。
